trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_000<tab>Welcome to our village, traveler! Is there anything I can help you with?

TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_010<tab>I'm a fisher, and a good one at that. I'll reel you in the biggest catch from the open sea...or something smaller by the shore if you'd prefer. Your choice.
TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_011<tab>Now if only I were as skilled with a rudder as I am with a net! Some days I find myself so far from shore that I miss the morning rush at the bazaar...
TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_020<tab>This is the fishing village of Akyaali. You can think of it as the fishers' Yedlihmad...which is perhaps not such a helpful analogy for foreigners.
TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_021<tab>Of course, we've had few merchants coming to either port since that horrible tower appeared. Not to mention the kidnappings... <shudder>

TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_022<tab>Even so, the tower's disappearance has been a relief to all of us who depend on trade with foreign nations. Though demand for medicinal bounties remains high...
TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_023<tab>No matter what happens, I must be here to supply ingredients for the alchemists' medicines. I must remain strong.

TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_024<tab>For a time I was worried we would not weather the storm, even should the sky-fire and coming of blasphemies cease... But the fish are returning, and business with them.

TEXT_REGISB5AKYAALI_00747_AMBHAS_000_025<tab>Just when I thought quiet and calm had returned to Akyaali, a most strange pillar of light was sighted off the coast, and there were no few fishing boats out on the water at the time. I know not what caused it, but I pray our brothers and sisters remain unharmed.
